Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, the fabric contains a number of small white inclusions, the exterior is covered with a red-slip and white-painted wavy-line and dot decoration, remains of seven lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394571) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394571)
